DOC.detailed_description: This study cluster-randomized , two-arm control trial primary care setting . A total 18 primary care clinic inclusive low income population high percentage African Americans urban rural area across Louisiana randomize either 1 ) intervention 2 ) usual care . The sample include 1,080 obese ( BMI 30-45 kg/m2 ) patient ( 18 clinic , 60 patient / clinic ) . The primary aim trial develop test effectiveness 24 month , patient-centered , pragmatic scalable obesity treatment program deliver within primary care , inclusive underserved population . Patients intervention arm attend weekly ( 15 in-person ) session first six month , follow monthly session remain 18 month . The behavioral intervention deliver trained health coach embed primary care clinic . Primary Care Practitioners intervention arm receive series webinars obesity science help manage treat obese patient . Patients assign usual care arm continue interact Primary Care Practitioner accord usual schedule , invite attend series social meeting topic interest , include importance sleep health , household money management , family cop skill , smoke cessation , etc .
